cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 1135 mi (1825 km) E of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest and forecast to arc northwest, passing north of the Leeward Islands and staying well north of the U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: none indicated – center expected to remain over open Atlantic north of the Leeward Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and adjacent Atlantic waters; cone brushes the northern U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.wind: Low (9%) chance that tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds reach St. Croix late Sunday into Monday; stronger winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; center forecast to remain well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only scattered outer rainbands possible; heavy rainfall ≥4 in not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing swells and rough seas in the Atlantic exposures late weekend could hamper port operations.
